intro: Crotalaria elliptica var. multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant has compound leaves with oval-shaped leaflets and produces clusters of small, yellow blooms. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant flowers and adaptability to various soil types. Additionally, it has been studied for its potential medicinal properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities.
